avalancheActivity.comment: Fresh snow and drifts are triggerable esp. on steep shady slopes. One sole skier can trigger a small-to-medium loose-snow or slab avalanche. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate caution. On steep grass-covered slopes with sufficient snow on the ground or atop smooth ground, isolated small-to-medium glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: freshly generated snowdrift accumulations at high altitudes

snowpackStructure.comment: At high altitudes 15-25 cm of fresh snow was registered by Friday evening. During the night and on Saturday, another 10cm is expected regionally, accompanied by moderate-velocity winds which will deposited fresh snowdrifts atop soft layers on shady slopes, often with blanketed graupel, bonding only moderately good. The below average snowpack is well consolidated. On sunny slopes and at lower altitudes the fresh snow will fall on bare ground.40

tendency.highlights: On Sunday, cool with only a bit of fresh snowfall. Avalanche danger levels not expected to change significantly.

weatherForecast.comment: NIghttime skies will be gray with intermittent rainfall, snowfall above 700-1000m. On Saturday, dense cloud cover will dominate with intermittent fog, limiting visibility repeatedly. In morning, widespread snow snowers, in afternoon drier. At 2000m: -3 degrees. Mostly light southerly winds at high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: Fresh snow and drifts are trigger-sensitive esp on shady steep slopes, small-to-medium avalanches can be triggered by winter sports enthusiasts in steep terrain. Danger zones occur esp. on ridgeline shady steep slopes and in extremely steep terrain. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate caution. On steep grass-covered slopes with sufficient snow on the ground or atop smooth ground, increasingly frequent small-to-medium glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: small-area drifts above the timberline

snowpackStructure.comment: At high altitudes 20-30 cm of fresh snow was registered by Friday evening. During the night and on Saturday, another 5cm is expected regionally, accompanied by moderate-velocity winds which will deposited fresh snowdrifts atop soft layers on shady slopes, often with blanketed graupel, bonding only moderately good. The below average snowpack is well consolidated. On sunny slopes and at lower altitudes the fresh snow will fall on bare ground.

tendency.highlights: On Saturday, only intermittent snow showers. Avalanche danger levels not expected to change significantly.

weatherForecast.comment: NIghttime skies will be gray with intermittent rainfall, snowfall above 700-1000m. On Saturday, dense cloud cover will dominate with intermittent fog, limiting visibility repeatedly. In morning, widespread snow snowers, in afternoon drier. At 2000m: -3 degrees. Mostly light southerly winds at high altitudes.

customData.generalHeadline: Moderate avalanche danger regionally due to fresh snow and drifts
